ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: How to write different length papers, research papers, how to read through sources successfully, how to formulate an argument

I learned how to take close readings of individual scenes within a larger text and to dissect minute details that contributes to the overall meaning of a text or idea. I also learned how to conduct online research and how to engage with other scholarly sources within my own ideas and to reflect that on paper.

I learned so much. High school writing is so drastically different from college. I had to unlearn the skills Ive been taught my entire life, which made for such an intellectually challenging, yet engaging class. Ciru presented the course topics very clearly in typically a slideshow format. I learned and applied the following skills, which will stick with me throughout my academic career: engaging/entering an academic conversation, stakes, motives, open-ended conclusions, the thesis is answering a problem/question, close-readings, logical flow of sentence structure, and how arguments are not necessarily and do not have to be black and white (nuance). Oh, and how to accurate engage, represent, and finally weave credible academic sources of various kinds.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments:
Strengths: had a lot of discussions, professor feedback, super engaging 
Weaknesses: peer feedback wasn't that helpful imo because sometimes we got it instead of professor feedback which would've been more helpful

Strengths: Challenging ideas, high workload, a wide variety of diverse texts.

Weaknesses: Turnaround time between works very quick, it would be helpful to have a class or two dedicated to specifically going over essays that have been completed and review them as a class or something.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes! If you like Twilight or vampires, it's a great course to improve writing skills and talk about things you like.

Would definitely recommend, It's really hard to keep up with all of the work but you really challenge yourself and learn a lot. Would also recommend because it also helped with my knowledge of Twilight, Dracula, and the vampire worlds in addition to writing itself. Will definitely be going with friends to locations in the film for fun over winter break!

extras.title: ENGL 114 32 - Living in the Twilight Zone
